alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 12 at 11:36PM EST until January 13 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EST Saturday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 3:54 AM and 4:14 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 3:18 AM and 3:38 PM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 2:07 AM and 2:57 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/03 AM 3.6 2.0 2.3 3.0 Moderate 13/02 PM 2.4 0.8 1.1 3.0 None 14/04 AM 1.8 0.2 0.5 1.0 None 14/03 PM 1.3 -0.3 0.0 2.0 None 15/04 AM 1.3 -0.3 0.0 1.0 None 15/05 PM 1.7 0.1 0.3 0.5 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
